title.narrative: Somalia Education for Human Capital Development Project

description.narrative: Increase access to primary education in underserved areas, with a focus on girls, and improve quality of instruction.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Education, Culture and Higher Education

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
Planned end date of the activity
Planned start date of the activity

mailing-address.narrative: The World Bank, 1818 H Street, NW, Washington, DC 20433 USA

description.narrative: Total Commitment in Second Quarter of 2021
Total Disbursement in First Quarter of 2022

condition.narrative: Schedule 2, Section I.A.1(a) of the Financing Agreement: the Recipient shall establish within 12 months of effectiveness andmaintain throughout Project implementation a Project Steering Committee (“PSC”) to provide overall strategic guidance andcoordination for the Project.

Schedule 2, Section I.A.1(b) of the Financing Agreement: the Recipient shall establish and thereafter maintain within the Ministryof Education, Culture and Higher Education throughout the period of Project implementation, a Project Management Unit under termsofreference acceptable to the Association and including a procurement specialist, a financial management specialist, anenvironmental specialist, a social specialist, a GBV specialist, monitoring and evaluation specialist and communication specialist.

Schedule 2, Section I.A.1(c) of the Financing Agreement: the Recipient shall establish by no later than three (3) months after theEffective Date, and thereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, a Project Management Committee to serve asa platform for collaboration, management, troubleshooting and technical support for implementation of the Project includingapproving Annual Work Plans and Budgets and conducting quarterly progress review of Project implementation.

Schedule 2, Section I.A.1(d) of the Financing Agreement: the Recipient shall maintain, throughout the period of implementation ofthe Project, the EAFS Unit, established within MoF's Office of Accountant General, with competent, experienced and qualified staff,in sufficient numbers and under terms of reference acceptable to the Association.

Schedule 2, Section I.A.2 of the Financing Agreement: Prior to implementing any activities under Part 2 and 3 of the Project in, orfor the benefit of, any Federal Member State, the Recipient shall cause that Federal Member States to: (a) enter into a subsidiaryagreement in accordance with Sub-section I.B.1 of this Schedule 2; and (b) establish within the respective FMS-MoE, and thereaftermaintain throughout the period Project implementation, a state implementation unit.

Schedule 2, Section I.B.2 of the Financing Agreement: For the purpose of the implementing Part 3 of the Project, the Recipientshall enter into agreement with the Somali National University, in the form and substance satisfactory to the Association, asfurther detailed in the Project Operations Manual.

Schedule 2, Section I.D of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient, through its Project Management Unit and with the assistance ofthe FMS Implementation Units, shall: (a) prepare and furnish to the Association on an annual basis, by no later than November 1stofeach year, commencing on November 1, 2021, the annual work plan and budget containing all activities proposed to be included inthe Project during the following Fiscal Year, and a proposed financing plan (setting forth the proposed amounts and sources offinancing including the portion of Counterpart Funds to be provided) for expenditures required for such activities. The Annual WorkPlan and Budget for the first year of Project implementation shall be prepared by the Recipient by not later than three (3) monthsafter the Effective Date.

Schedule 2, Section I.E of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall select and engage, by no later than six (6) months afterthe Effective Date, and thereafter retain throughout the period of implementation of the Project, the services of a duly qualifiedand experienced monitoring consultant satisfactory to the Association, under terms of reference acceptable to the Association, inorder to monitor the achievement of the Project's objectives.
